channel.title: chamoru phrases on Hinanao-hu
channel.description: On a journey to learn Chamoru via blogging in Chamoru!

item.title: Adingani i Lahi-hu Pt. 2
item.author: DJTai@pm.me (David Jesus Taitingfong)
item.description: I finene’na na blog guini. Buenas yan h√•fa adai todus hamyu! √Öpmam na tiempu na m√•nggi' yu' guini, hunggan? Gi minag√•het, gof tinani' yu' desde ki t√•tti hugua na pulan.
item.content:encoded:
I finene’na na blog guini.

Buenas yan h√•fa adai todus hamyu! √Öpmam na tiempu na m√•nggi' yu' guini, hunggan? Gi minag√•het, gof tinani' yu' desde ki t√•tti hugua na pulan. Kada diha hu ripiti ta’lu na bid√•-hu: makm√•ta yu' yan etsisiu pat chochu, pues macho’chu', ya pues hug√•ndu yan i lahi-hu. Todu eyu ha tifi' yu', lol.

I asunto put ini na blog kosa ki hu m√•s p√•tti hamyu ni taiminapput sin√•ngan siha na hu sang√•ni i lahi-hu.

Yanngen gailinachi gi ini na tinigi'-hu, pues sang√•ni yu' fan — Estudi√•nti ha' yu' yan kada diha tumutungu' yu'.

Sin√•ngan Siha Ni' Hu Sang√•ni i Lahi-hu

Chamoru English
Para m√•nu hao? Where are you going?
H√•fa un li’i' gi hiyung? What do you see outside?
Kao un li’i' i batkun airi? Did you see the airplane?
Mungnga mamacha ni iyo-ku Don’t touch my stuff
Kao h√•spuk pat √±√•lang ha' hao? Are you full or still hungry?
H√•fa iyo-mu? Gi kannai-mu? What do you have? In your hand?
Hu tungu' na yayas hao pues maigu' p√•’gu I know you’re tired so sleep now
Ai adai, kao tum√•ki' hao? Gof mutung! Ai adai, did you poop? So stinky!
Nihi ta tulaika i pa√±√•les-mu Let’s change your diaper
Gimen i gimen-mu leche kosa ki para ta fanmaigu' Drink your milk so we (3) can go to sleep

Todu ha' para p√•’gu.

Bula guinaiya. DJT.

English Translation

The 1st blog is here.

Hello everyone! It’s been a long time since I’ve written here, yeah? Honestly, I’ve been really busy these past two months. Every day, I do what I typically do: wake up and exercise or eat, then I work, and then I play with my son. It all drains me, lol.

The reason for this blog is so that I can share more simple phrases I tell my son.

If there are mistakes in this blog, then tell me please — I’m still a student and learning every day.

Phrases I Tell My Son

‚¨Ü go back up to read the phrases üòÅ

That’s it for now.

All love. DJT.
item.dc:creator: David Jesus Taitingfong

item.title: Adingani i Lahi-hu
item.author: DJTai@pm.me (David Jesus Taitingfong)
item.description: Note: updated 2020-12-22 by removing reference to my since-deleted write.as blog. Most of the Chamoru that I’ve been using lately is towards i lahi-hu.
item.content:encoded:
Note: updated 2020-12-22 by removing reference to my since-deleted write.as blog.

Most of the Chamoru that I’ve been using lately is towards i lahi-hu. H√•cha na s√•kkan id√•t-√±a, pues inadingan-m√•mi ni ti mapput.

I wanted to share some of those phrases with you and perhaps get some feedback. If you’re here then I’ll assume you came from Twitter, IG, or some other social media site. Feel free to hit me up on any of those.

Nihi ta tutuhun.

Sin√•ngan Siha ni' Hu Sang√•ni i Lahi-hu

Phrases I Tell My Son

Chamoru English
Nihi ta tulaika i mag√•gu-mu Let’s change your clothes
Nihi ta h√•nao Let’s go
H√•nao! Huyung neni Go! Out neni
H√•nao yan sodda' si nan√•-mu Go and find your mom
H√•fa bidad√•-mu? What are you doing?
N√•’i yu' nu gi kannai-mu Give me what’s in your hand
Kao √±√•lang hao? Are you hungry?
Kao malagu' hao chumochu? Do you want to eat?
Kao h√•spuk hao? Are you full?
Kao ma’o hao? Are you thirsty?
H√•yi ennao/eyu? Who is that?
Maila' m√•gi Come here
Nihi ta baila! Let’s dance!
Baila' yan guahu Dance with me
Mungnga mangassas hao fan Don’t scratch yourself please
Mungnga ennao Don’t do that
Mungnga kum√•ti fan Please don’t cry
Sa' h√•fa kum√•kati hao neni? Why are you crying neni?
Atan yu' Look at me
Kao matuhuk hao? Are you sleepy?
Kao esta yayas hao? Are you already tired?

Definitely simple phrases that I hope my son will catch on to. Gi minag√•het, hu tungu' na ha kumprendi na ilek-hu ya ennao ha gof na’magof yu'.

Todu ha' para p√•’gu.

Bula guinaiya — DJT.
